abstract: More hotels are trying to accommodate guests by allowing them to text hotel concierges with their needs and requests; effort, which has been capitalized on by start-ups like Zingle, is meant to encourage use of food and beverage services, and to quickly and efficiently address guest grievances.
lead_paragraph: New apps allow hotel guests to make requests by texting, a bid to preserve good ratings on review websites and reverse a slide in room service orders.

headline.main: No Need to Call the Front Desk, Just Send a Text
headline.print_headline: More Hotels Put Their Concierges at Guests’ Beck, Call and Text Message
